content: परिकरः {@--1@} Retinue, train, attendants, followers. {@--2@} A multitude collection, crowd; <ls>Ratn. 3. 5.</ls> {@--3@} A beginning, commencement; <ls>Bh. 1. 6.</ls> {@--4@} A girth, waist-band, cloth worn round the loins; अहिपरिकरभाजः <ls>Śi. 4. 65</ls>; परिकरं बंध् or कृ ‘to gird up one's loins, to make oneself. ready, prepare oneself for any action’; बध्नन्सवेगं परिकरं <ls>K. 170</ls>; कृतपरिकरस्य भवादृशस्य त्रैलोक्यमपि न क्षमं परिपंथीभवितुं <ls>Ve. 3</ls>; <ls>G. L. 47</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 92</ls>; <ls>U. 5. 12.</ls> {@--5@} A sofa. {@--6@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of a figure of speech which consists in the use of significant epithets; विशेषणैर्यत्साकूतैरुक्तिः परिकरस्तु सः <ls>K. P. 10</ls>; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} सुधांशुकालतोत्तंसस्तापं हरतु वः शिवः <ls>Chandr. 5. 59.</ls> {@--7@} (In dramaturgy) Covert or indirect intimation of coming events in the plot of a drama, the germ or the बीज <ab>q. v.</ab>; see <ls>S. D. 340.</ls> {@--8@} Judgment. {@--9@} A helper, colleague, co-worker.
